textContent:
In this world of logic and structure, for feeling has dwindled but the need for it has only exponentially grown. It's not the logic and structures that are holding us back now. Separating us and isolating us, it's the lack of feeling our feelings and relating to the feelings of others. Music and art has always been a conduit for feeling.

What if we created a platform for artists of all genres and mediums, to come together and help us connect to our feelings? 

What if we hold a concert series focused on sets that tap into the feelings? We haven't let ourselves feel? This is the continuation of group therapy by above& beyond carried into dance therapy, put on by DABY and DJ dogood. 

If that idea catches on, what if we hold a feeling Festival where we invite artists of other genres and other mediums to come display art and music and dance in a way that helps the festival attendees experience the feelings they have inside? We have melancholy and sadness and grief. We have joy and euphoria and elation. We have confusion and liminal space. And curate the experience to these emotions. 

And what if we create a platform to amplify connect support and nurture artists who are striving to express the feelings they have inside through their mediums, allowing them a space to share these gifts with the world? World? Which could be self-organized concerts, self-organized art festivals, self-organized experiences all under the banner of feeling our feelings? 

I think this is already happening and people are already experiencing this, it's now a step in making it intentional and focused and curated with purpose at the center to help further support the needs we have as an individual as a society and as a people to feel.
